column5: Took the kids and wife to lake Erie yesterday. Great day for all...morning with hundreds of perch for the kids on friend's boat and beach relaxation for the wife. Everyone's happy Lost track of the doubles...I used to do lot of perching on Simcoe but doing it for second year on Erie and let me tell you...it is many many times better bite and better/larger fish than Simcoe. Amazing fishery for sure. Got an easy 4 men limit by 11am. Few shots bellow:              Cheers, Ice Fisherman
Wow, that looks like a trip EVERYONE will remember!  Those are some darn nice perchies!
Gotta luv the central basin of Lake Erie perch all season long and some of the best steelhead and walleye fishing availible for much of the summer
huge!! i fidhed longpoint and pottohawk last week bite was average and alot of throwbacks. great size!!
Those perch got some meat to them! Good on ya
Looks like a great weekend Emil
What a great day for the family! Thanks for the pics...you got some monsters in there. The boys must have loved it too.

Awesome Emil! Nicely done... I remember as a kid, my parents would take us to Port Bruce for pier fishing and swimming... some of my fondest memiories as a kid. I'm sure yours will also store those memories away... Be careful thought, if BB gets wind of those Perchies, you may find him following you around! LOL HH
Tasty report.  I know what you mean about simcoe perchin.  Too much time spent weedin out the dinks.  You gotta try the Nipissing perchin next winter!
How do you find them? I fish near Port Maitland most of the time and haven't been able to find a feed yet.
I am fishing out of Lowbanks.  The schools have been HUGE, but not a lot of keepers.  Great job!
I guess BillyBob didnt get them all after all.LOL  Nice feed there Emil.
I was thinking the same thing... Although nip doesn't perform that good in the summer.  Looks like an incredible time!!!
